description: From Ancient Greek ξενία (xenía, “hospitality; relations of hospitality between states or between a person and a state; the status of an alien, i.e., not a citizen”).

adjectives.description: xenial (comparative more xenial, superlative most xenial) (uncommon)

entries.meaning: Hospitable, especially to visiting strangers or foreigners.
Of the relation between a host and guest; friendly.
